tly.

t (mild dig at Cedric) - as such, a moniker isn't strictly

hough it wouldn't hurt).
>
> Oh?
>
> Most IDEs I've used start a new proces=
s each time you ask them to run
> test(s).  So in Eclipse (which I'm using =
now), how does the TestCase
> instance in the first test process, which has=
 terminated, get into a
> new test process that is now starting up?

In the=
 event of failing tests, the process is left alive until you
start another =
test run, I guess. That's how it works in IntelliJ.

May I suggest trying i=
t and see it work? Because it does.
